channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Decking for seating area built over linkbox and electricity cables, 10th June
item.description:
We have reports that a decking area has been installed over a linkbox in the highway in front of 198 Broadway Bexleyheath DA6 7BD. The land title appears to only cover the building and not any land infront of the restaurant like other businesses further along the road and across the road. Our linkbox would have been installed under our rights included in the highway act. Do you know if this a contravention of the highway/footway on this occasion. As it would appear so.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Banks Lane, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling bin lids locked causing unhygienic pile up, 10th June
item.description:
The 3 recycling bins on Dunton Road; 2 of them have locked lids which disallows residents to throw their recycling in the bin. This means all the bags are just left around the bins and is unhygienic. Please can the 2 bind lids be unlocked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Setchell Road, Old Kent Road, London

item.title: Vermin, 10th June
item.description:
Vermin are coming to our balcony (also our neighbour at no14). first spotted 31.05.25.We are on the 5th floor. In order to get to our balcony they must be passing through Hackney’s demise. We would like Hackney to address this environmental health problem
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Casbeard Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial waste bins do not belong on pavements!, 10th June
item.description:
In the past, the operators for these bins have been responsible and collected them from their storage location, emptied them in their truck, and returned the bins to position. But from time to time, and what feels like probably the last month or so, residents and visitors and a large number of pedestrians just passing through this busy area have had to navigate around this mess of bins. It’s not right. I could speculate as to reasons - drivers parking their cars where the bins are kept, laziness on part of waste operator, or lack of care bin owner. Whatever. Please can we have some respect for this environment and the people who live here. If those bins cannot be operated correctly then the business owners ought to be required to have their rubbish collected more directly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Devonshire Mews, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of growth at base of tree, 10th June
item.description:
The branches at the base of the tree are now stretching out onto the road making it difficult for parking here (outside 22 Rowley Avenue). They are also stretching across the grass verge so the grass cutters are not able to cut the grass properly. To my knowledge this tree has never been pruned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Rowley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The grass in dog area is very long, 10th June
item.description:
The grass in the dog area is very long, rubbish is being left in the grass including g glass bottles. Dog area eating food that’s in there and becoming unwell. People re leaving dog pooh because they don’t want to walk in the long grass.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Goddington, London
